entry.title: Dorset and Somerset Air Ambulance Visit
entry.summary: Last night at Cubs we had the privilege to welcome volunteers from Dorset and Somerset Air Ambulance to visit us. We had a great time learning about CPR and what to do in an emergency first aid situation. It was such an informative night all…
entry.content:
Last night at Cubs we had the privilege to welcome volunteers from Dorset and Somerset Air Ambulance to visit us. We had a great time learning about CPR and what to do in an emergency first aid situation. It was such an informative night all round, culminating with making some Paper Helicopters.
 
Special thanks to Alfie who went out at the weekend to raise over £30 in donations that we gave to Dorset and Somerset Air Ambulance. If you would like to donate, please follow this link https://www.dsairambulance.org.uk/.../donate.../credit-card

entry.title: 8 New Scouts
entry.summary: What a great night for the Scouts last night. Investing a total of 8 new Scouts into the group. 3 of these have moved up from Cubs and the remaining are new intakes. Its great to see the group and Scouts thriving.
entry.content: What a great night for the Scouts last night. Investing a total of 8 new Scouts into the group. 3 of these have moved up from Cubs and the remaining are new intakes. Its great to see the group and Scouts thriving.

entry.title: Egg Drop
entry.summary: We took part in an egg drop Eggperiment. The Cubs were given raw eggs that would be dropped from different heights. Each time the "passenger" had to survive the drop. If they survived, they would go even higher. The Cubs did really well, and we…
entry.content: We took part in an egg drop Eggperiment. The Cubs were given raw eggs that would be dropped from different heights. Each time the "passenger" had to survive the drop. If they survived, they would go even higher. The Cubs did really well, and we have 2 survivors dropping from over 3 m in height.

entry.title: Chief Scout Silver award
entry.summary: What an honour tonight. I was able to award the Chief Scout's Silver Award to two of our Cubs tonight for the first time. Cameron and Toby have worked really hard in the last few months to finish off all the challenge badges with the…
entry.content:
What an honour tonight. I was able to award the Chief Scout's Silver Award to two of our Cubs tonight for the first time. Cameron and Toby have worked really hard in the last few months to finish off all the challenge badges with the aim for Silver to be awarded at Cub camp which happened last weekend.
Its great to watch them grown and learn new skills through Scouting and to award them their Chief Scout's Silver Award is amazing.
Well done.

entry.title: Cub Camp
entry.summary: A couple of weekends ago we took our Cubs to the East Somerset Scout District Cub camp. This was such an amazing weekend and the first time some of the Cubs were away from their parents overnight. Such a fun weekend! There were various competitions…
entry.content:
A couple of weekends ago we took our Cubs to the East Somerset Scout District Cub camp. This was such an amazing weekend and the first time some of the Cubs were away from their parents overnight. Such a fun weekend!

There were various competitions over the weekend, and we managed 3rd in the Rifle shooting and 3rd in the Tug-o-War.

entry.title: Remembrance Sunday
entry.summary: We were fortunate enough to take part in the Annual Remembrance Sunday parade through Frome town. Its so important to spend a small amount of time remembering those who gave their lives so we don't have too.
entry.content: We were fortunate enough to take part in the Annual Remembrance Sunday parade through Frome town. Its so important to spend a small amount of time remembering those who gave their lives so we don't have too.

entry.title: Centaur Hike
entry.summary: The Cubs have just taken part in the First District Centaur Hike. What a great day. Not much moaning considering it was 6.7 km. As it was our first time taking the Cubs on the Centaur we decided to enter 2 Novice teams, each team…
entry.content:
The Cubs have just taken part in the First District Centaur Hike. What a great day. Not much moaning considering it was 6.7 km. As it was our first time taking the Cubs on the Centaur we decided to enter 2 Novice teams, each team doing the route in reverse order. I can only say how proud I am of the Cubs for getting round and thoroughly enjoy themselves. 

We did miss out on the "Official"  Lunch stop at 5th / 7th Wells Scout Group because we did not pay enough attention but we did have a lovely lunch just up the road.

entry.title: Self defence
entry.summary: We were very lucky to have Sensei-Katie law come along to our Cub night and go through some self defence move with the Cubs. Interestingly the highlight seemed to be when the leaders were used to demonstrate the moves.
entry.content: We were very lucky to have Sensei-Katie law come along to our Cub night and go through some self defence move with the Cubs. Interestingly the highlight seemed to be when the leaders were used to demonstrate the moves.

entry.title: Pancake night.
entry.summary: Tonight at Cubs we talked about our founder, Robert Baden-Powell as it’s his birthday today. Always nice to understand our history. We then cooked pancakes on our modified tin can burners.. now known as ‘spider cookers’.. worked well.. when they remembered their oil.
entry.content: Tonight at Cubs we talked about our founder, Robert Baden-Powell as it’s his birthday today. Always nice to understand our history. We then cooked pancakes on our modified tin can burners.. now known as ‘spider cookers’.. worked well.. when they remembered their oil.

entry.title: Fire Safety
entry.summary: Tonight, we tried something a little different. We setup a couple of firepits in the carpark to teach the Cubs about fire safety. One of our Senior Sixers took small groups of Cubs through fire lighting skills and how to do things safely. They then…
entry.content:
Tonight, we tried something a little different. We setup a couple of firepits in the carpark to teach the Cubs about fire safety.

One of our Senior Sixers took small groups of Cubs through fire lighting skills and how to do things safely. They then built small tepee or log cabin fires and light them.

While this was going on we had another fire pit where we toasted some marshmallow, made smors and made campfire popcorn! This worked out so much better than we thought! So much fun tonight.
